intro: Celtis ituriensis, commonly known as the African hackberry, is a deciduous tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Cannabaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and heart-shaped leaves. The tree produces small, greenish-white flowers that are followed by spherical, greenish fruits. Celtis ituriensis is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
